articles.title: Africa : Refugee Camps Set to Be Uninhabitable By 2050 As Extreme Weather Worsen
articles.summary: At least 117 million people have been displaced by war, violence and persecution, the UN refugee agency (UNHCR) said on Monday, while highlighting how much their plight is tied to the growing climate crisis. 'Whether it is floods sweeping South Sudan and Brazil, record-breaking heat in Kenya and Pakistan, or water shortages in Chad and Ethiopia, extreme weather is pushing already fragile communities to the brink,' the UN agency said. articles.title: Polls Close in New York Mayoral Election as Frontrunner Mamdani Responds to Trum
articles.summary: NEW YORK - As polls from Brooklyn to the Bronx quieted after the morning rush, New York City was already seeing unprecedented turnout in its historic mayoral election. articles.title: Explosion in Delhi kills at least nine
articles.summary: A high-intensity explosion in a slow-moving car outside the Red Fort in central Delhi left at least nine people dead and more than 20 injured on November 11, sparking a nationwide alert and a multi-agency investigation. A person in whose name the car was registered was detained in Gurugram, Haryana. ‚ÄúA slow-moving car stopped at the red light outside Red Fort around 6.52 p.m. The explosion happened in that vehicle, and due to the explosion, vehic
